APIUsage: This API enables you to submit transaction requests to the payment gateway.

methods.title: Create a Transaction
methods.usage: Use this function to create a transaction request.

request.name: createTransactionRequest

children.name: merchantAuthentication
children.value: Contains merchant authentication information.

children.name: name
children.value: Merchant’s unique API Login ID.
children.notes:
The merchant API Login ID is provided in the Merchant Interface and must be stored securely. 

The API Login ID and Transaction Key together provide the merchant authentication required for access to the payment gateway.

children.name: transactionKey
children.value: Merchant’s unique Transaction Key.
children.notes:
The merchant Transaction Key is provided in the Merchant Interface and must be stored securely. 

The API Login ID and Transaction Key together provide the merchant authentication required for access to the payment gateway.

children.name: mobileDeviceId
children.value: Unique identifier for a mobile device.

children.name: refId
children.value: Merchant-assigned reference ID for the request.
children.notes:
If included in the request, this value will be included in the response. This feature might be especially useful for multi-threaded applications.

This element is not used for mobile device requests. Use mobileDeviceId instead.

children.name: transactionRequest
children.value: Transaction information. This element includes all of the fields that follow.

children.name: transactionType
children.value: Type of credit card transaction.
children.format:
One of the following:

* authOnlyTransaction
* authCaptureTransaction
* captureOnlyTransaction
* refundTransaction
* priorAuthCapture
* Transaction
* voidTransaction
children.notes: If the value submitted does not match a supported value, the transaction is rejected. If this field is not submitted or the value is blank, the payment gateway will process the transaction as an authCaptureTransaction.

children.name: amount
children.value: Amount of the transaction.
children.format: Up to 15 digits with a decimal point (no dollar symbol. For example, 8.95
children.notes: This is the total amount and must include tax, shipping, and any other charges. The amount can either be hard coded or posted to a script.

children.name: paymentType
children.value: This section includes payment information.

children.name: trackData
children.value: trackData can contain track1 and track2.

children.name: track1
children.value:
(Applies to Card Present only.)

Conditional 

Required only if track2, cardNumber, and expirationDate are absent.
children.format:
Valid Track 1 data.

Note: Starting and ending sentinel characters must be discarded before submitting transactions.
children.notes:
Track 1 data read from credit card. It is not necessary to submit Track 1 and Track 2 data, and cardNumber and expirationDate. If both tracks are sent by the POS application, the gateway will use the Track 1 information. 

If neither Track 1 nor Track 2 data is submitted, but cardNumber and expirationDate are submitted, the Card Present transaction rate may be downgraded.

children.name: track2
children.value:
(Applies to Card Present only.)

Conditional 

Required only if track1 and cardNumber, and expirationDate are absent.
children.format:
Valid Track 2 data.

Note: Starting and ending sentinel characters must be discarded before submitting transactions.
children.notes:
Track 2 data read from credit card. This information is required only if Track 1 and cardNumber and expirationDate are absent. It is not necessary to submit Track 1 and Track 2 data, and cardNumber and expirationDate. If both tracks are sent by the POS application, the gateway will use the Track 1 information. 

If neither Track 1 nor Track 2 data is submitted, but cardNumber and expirationDate are submitted, the Card Present transaction rate may be downgraded.

children.name: encryptedTrackData
children.value: The following elements are required only when using an encrypted card reader.

children.name: FormOfPayment
children.value: Contains the value element.

children.name: Value
children.value: Contains the encoding element.

children.name: Encoding
children.value:
Used to specify the encoding for data in the request.
 
If the response contains decrypted data, then it will be encoded using this setting.

children.name: EncryptionAlgorithm
children.value: TDES
children.notes: Specifies the algorithm used to encrypt the payment data. Currently, only TDES is supported.

children.name: Scheme
children.value: Contains the DUKPT element.

children.name: DUKPT
children.value: Contains the Operation element.

children.name: Operation
children.value: DECRYPT
children.notes:
Used to specify the cryptographic operation to perform on the request data.

Currently, only Decrypt is supported and must be specified.

children.name: Mode
children.value: Contains the Data element.

children.name: Data
children.format:
Boolean.
 
1 means true and is currently the only value supported.
children.notes: Used to specify that DUKPT decrypt.

children.name: DeviceInfo
children.value: Contains the Description element.

children.name: Description
children.value: Metadata string used to control how the request is ultimately processed.
children.notes:
Contains key value pairs with the following format:

* KEY_NAME=KEY_VALUE^KEYn_NAME=KEYn_VALUE
Where 
KEY_NAME is an alphanumeric identifier and may 
contain a period (.), hyphen (-), and underscore (_).

* = separates a key name and its value.

* KEY_VALUE is the value of the preceding key. It 
cannot contain the following special characters: 
\ , ; = < > % ^ 
The \ character can be used to escape special 
characters.

* The ^ separator can be used between additional key value pairs.

The ENCODING that is used is based on the Encoding set in the request.

Metadata is used to specify how the request should be processed. Currently, the required value in plain ASCII is: FID=IDTECH.UniMag.Android.Sdkv1

Note that this string can be used with any supported platform, despite the term “android.�?

Hex Encoded:
4649443D4944544543482E556E694D61672E416E64726F69642E53646B7631

Base64 Encoded:
RklEPUlEVEVDSC5VbmlNYWcuQW5kcm9pZC5TZGt2MQ==

children.name: EncryptedData
children.value: Contains Value element.

children.name: Value
children.value: Encrypted card data.
children.notes: Encoded card reader data that contains encrypted tracks and KSN.

children.name: creditCard
children.value: The following elements belong to the <creditCard> element; include them only for credit card transactions.

children.name: cardNumber
children.value: The customer’s credit card number.
children.format:
Between 13 and 16 digits without spaces

Only the last four digits are required for credit card transactions.
children.notes:
Optional for Card Present.

This is sensitive cardholder information and must be stored securely and in accordance with the Payment Card Industry (PCI) Data Security Standard. 

For more information about PCI, please refer to the Standards, Compliance and Security developer training video at http://developer.authorize.net/training.

children.name: expirationDate
children.value: The customer’s credit card expiration date.
children.format:
One of the following:

MMYY, 
MM/YY, 
MM-YY, MMYYYY, 
MM/YYYY, 
MM-YYYY
children.notes:
Optional for Card Present.

This is sensitive cardholder information and must be stored securely and in accordance with the Payment Card Industry (PCI) Data Security Standard. 

For more information about PCI, please refer to the Standards, Compliance and Security developer training video at http://developer.authorize.net/training.

children.name: cardCode
children.value: The customer’s card code.
children.notes:
The three- or four-digit number on the back of a credit card (on the front for American Express). 

This field is required if the merchant would like to use the Card Code Verification (CCV) security feature. 

Cardholder information must be stored securely and in accordance with the Payment Card Industry (PCI) Data Security Standard. 

For more information about PCI, please refer to the Standards, Compliance and Security developer training video at http://developer.authorize.net/training.

children.name: bankAccount
children.value: The following elements belong to the <bankAccount> element; include them only for bank account transactions.

children.name: accountNumber
children.value: Account number, masked.

children.name: routingNumber
children.value: Bank's routing number.

children.name: nameOnAccount
children.value: Name of the person who holds the bank account.

children.name: bankName
children.value: The name of the bank.

children.name: echeckType
children.value: The type of eCheck transaction.

children.name: authCode
children.value: Authorization code.

children.name: refTransId
children.value: Transaction ID of the original partial authorization transaction.
children.notes:
Required only for refundTransaction, priorAuthCaptureTransaction, and 
voidTransaction. 

Do not include this field if you are 
providing splitTenderId

children.name: splitTenderId
children.value:
The payment gateway-assigned ID 
that links the current authorization request to the original authorization request.
children.notes:
This value applies to partial authorization transactions only, and is returned in the reply 
message from the original authorization request.

children.name: order
children.value: Contains information about the order.

children.name: invoiceNumber
children.value: Merchant-defined invoice number associated with the order.

children.name: Description
children.value: Description of the item purchased.

children.name: lineItems
children.value: Contains one or more <lineItem> elements (the maximum is 30 line items.

children.name: lineItem
children.value: Describes one line item of the order.

children.name: itemId
children.value: Item identification.

children.name: name
children.value: Name of the item.

children.name: description
children.value: Description of the item.

children.name: quantity
children.value: Quantity purchased.
children.format: Up to two decimal places. Must be a positive number

children.name: unitPrice
children.value: Price of one item.
children.notes: Cost of an item per unit, excluding tax, freight, and duty.

children.name: tax
children.value: Contains information about any taxes applied.

children.name: amount
children.value: Amount of tax.
children.format: Format can include up to two decimal points. For example, 1.27.
children.notes: Total amount of the transaction must include this amount.

children.name: name
children.value: Name of tax.

children.name: description
children.value: Description of tax.

children.name: duty
children.value: Contains information about any duty applied.

children.name: amount
children.value: Amount of duty.

children.name: name
children.value: Name of duty.

children.name: description
children.value: Description of duty.

children.name: shipping
children.value: Items in this section describe shipping charges applied.

children.name: amount
children.value: Amount of shipping charges.
children.notes: Description of shipping charges.

children.name: name
children.value: Name of shipping charges.

children.name: description
children.value: Description of shipping charges.

children.name: taxExempt
children.value: Indicates whether or not order is exempt from tax.

children.name: poNumber
children.value: The merchant-assigned purchase order number.
children.notes: Purchase order number must be created dynamically on the merchant's server or provided on a per-transaction basis. The payment gateway does not perform this function.

children.name: customer
children.value: The following fields contain customer information.

children.name: id
children.value: Merchant assigned customer ID.
children.notes:
Unique identifier to represent the customer associated with the transaction.

Customer ID must be created dynamically on the merchant's server or provided for each transaction. The payment gateway does not perform this function.

children.name: email
children.value: The customer’s valid email address.
children.format:
Up to 255 characters.

For example, janedoe@customer.com
children.notes:
Required only when using a European Payment Processor. Processing Platform.

Email address to which the customer’s copy of the email receipt is sent when Email Receipts is configured in the Merchant Interface. The email is sent to the customer only if the email address format is valid.

children.name: billTo
children.value: This section contains billing address information.

children.name: firstName
children.value: First name associated with customer’s billing address.
children.notes: Required only when using a European Payment Processor.

children.name: lastName
children.value: Last name associated with customer’s billing address.
children.notes: Required only when using a European Payment Processor.

children.name: company
children.value: Company associated with customer’s billing address.

children.name: address
children.value: Customer’s billing address.
children.notes:
Required if merchant would like to use the Address Verification Service security feature.
 
Required when using GPN Canada or WorldPay Streamline Processing Platform.

children.name: city
children.value: City of customer’s billing address.
children.notes: Required only when using a European Payment Processor.

children.name: state
children.value: State of customer’s billing address.
children.format: Up to 40 characters (no symbols) or a valid two-character state code.
children.notes: Required only when using a European Payment Processor.

children.name: zip
children.value: ZIP code of customer’s billing address.
children.notes:
Required if merchant would like to use the Address Verification Service security feature.
 
Required when using GPN Canada or WorldPay Streamline Processing Platform.

children.name: country
children.value: Country of customer’s billing address.
children.notes: Required only when using a European Payment Processor.

children.name: phoneNumber
children.value: Phone number associated with customer’s billing address.
children.format:
Up to 25 digits (no letters).

For example, 
(123)123-1234

children.name: faxNumber
children.value: Fax number associated with customer’s billing address.
children.notes:
Up to 25 digits (no letters).

For example, 
(123)123-1234

children.name: shipTo
children.value: This section contains shipping information.

children.name: firstName
children.value: First name associated with customer’s shipping address.

children.name: lastName
children.value: Last name associated with customer’s shipping address.

children.name: company
children.value: Company associated with customer’s shipping address.

children.name: address
children.value: Customer’s shipping address.

children.name: city
children.value: City of customer’s shipping address.

children.name: state
children.value: State of customer’s shipping address.
children.format: Up to 40 characters (no symbols) or a valid two-character state code.

children.name: zip
children.value: ZIP code of customer’s shipping address.

children.name: country
children.value: Country of customer’s shipping address.

children.name: customerIP
children.value: IP address of customer initiating the transaction. If this value is not passed, it will default to 255.255.255.255.
children.format:
Up to 15 characters (no letters).

For example, 255.255.255.255
children.notes: Required only when the merchant is using customer IP based AFDS filters.

children.name: cardholderAuthentication
children.value:
Merchants using a third party cardholder authentication solution can submit the following authentication values with Visa and/or MasterCard transactions.

Note: invalid combinations of the following two fields will generate an error.

children.name: Authentication Indicator
children.value: The electronic commerce indicator (ECI) value for a Visa transaction; or the universal cardholder authentication field indicator (UCAF) for a MasterCard transaction obtained by the merchant after the authentication process.
children.format: Special characters included in this value must be URL encoded.
children.notes:
Required only for transactions processed through cardholder authentication programs. When submitted with other transaction types, this value is ignored.

This field is currently supported through Chase Paymentech, FDMS Nashville, Global Payments and TSYS.

children.name: Cardholder Authentication Value
children.value: The cardholder authentication verification value (CAVV) for a Visa transaction; or accountholder authentication value (AVV)/ universal cardholder authentication field (UCAF) for a MasterCard transaction obtained by the merchant after the authentication process.
children.format: Special characters included in this value must be URL encoded.
children.notes:
Required only for authOnly and authCapture transactions processed through cardholder authentication programs. When submitted with other transaction types, this value is ignored.

This field is currently supported through Chase Paymentech, FDMS Nashville, Global Payments and TSYS.

children.name: retail
children.value: The retail element contains two elements: marketType and deviceType.

children.name: marketType
children.value:
0 for ecommerce
1 for moto
2 for retail

children.name: deviceType
children.value: 7 for mobile POS

children.name: TransactionSettings
children.value: This section contains one or more <setting> elements.

children.name: setting
children.value: allowPartialAuth, duplicatWindow, emailCustomer, recurringBilling, or testRequest

children.name: settingValue
children.value: true or false

children.name: userFields
children.value: User-defined fields are allowed.

children.name: name
children.value: Name of the user-defined field.

children.name: value
children.value: Value of the user-defined field.

request.sample:
<createTransactionRequest xmlns="AnetApi/xml/v1/schema/AnetApiSchema.xsd">
  <merchantAuthentication>
    <name>API_LOGIN_ID</name>
    <transactionKey>API_TRANSACTION_KEY</transactionKey>
  </merchantAuthentication>
  <refId>123456</refId>
  <transactionRequest>
    <transactionType>authOnlyTransaction</transactionType>
    <amount>5</amount>
    <payment>
      <creditCard>
        <cardNumber>5424000000000015</cardNumber>
        <expirationDate>1220</expirationDate>
        <cardCode>999</cardCode>
      </creditCard>
    </payment>
    <lineItems>
      <lineItem>
        <itemId>1</itemId>
        <name>vase</name>
        <description>Cannes logo </description>
        <quantity>18</quantity>
        <unitPrice>45.00</unitPrice>
      </lineItem>
    </lineItems>
    <tax>
      <amount>4.26</amount>
      <name>level2 tax name</name>
      <description>level2 tax</description>
    </tax>
    <duty>
      <amount>8.55</amount>
      <name>duty name</name>
      <description>duty description</description>
    </duty>
    <shipping>
      <amount>4.26</amount>
      <name>level2 tax name</name>
      <description>level2 tax</description>
    </shipping>
    <poNumber>456654</poNumber>
    <billTo>
      <firstName>Ellen</firstName>
      <lastName>Johnson</lastName>
      <company>Souveniropolis</company>
      <address>14 Main Street</address>
      <city>Pecan Springs</city>
      <state>TX</state>
      <zip>44628</zip>
      <country>USA</country>
    </billTo>
    <shipTo>
      <firstName>China</firstName>
      <lastName>Bayles</lastName>
      <company>Thyme for Tea</company>
      <address>12 Main Street</address>
      <city>Pecan Springs</city>
      <state>TX</state>
      <zip>44628</zip>
      <country>USA</country>
    </shipTo>
    <customerIP>192.168.1.1</customerIP>
    <transactionSettings>
      <setting>
        <settingName>testRequest</settingName>
        <settingValue>false</settingValue>
      </setting>
    </transactionSettings>
    <userFields>
      <userField>
        <name>MerchantDefinedFieldName1</name>
        <value>MerchantDefinedFieldValue1</value>
      </userField>
      <userField>
        <name>favorite_color</name>
        <value>blue</value>
      </userField>
    </userFields>
  </transactionRequest>
</createTransactionRequest>

response.name: createTransactionResponse

children.name: refId
children.value: Merchant-assigned reference ID for the request.
children.notes: If included in the request, this value is included in the response. This feature might be especially useful for multi-threaded applications.

children.name: messages
children.value: This section contains information about the results of the request.

children.name: resultCode
children.value: Ok or Error.
children.notes: Contains additional information about the status of the request.

children.name: message
children.value: Contains specific message information.

children.name: code
children.value: Code number for message.

children.name: text
children.value: Text for the error message.

children.name: sessionToken
children.value: Returned for mobile device transactions, instead of a transactionKey.

children.name: responseCode
children.value: Overall status of the transaction.
children.format:
1 = Approved 
2 = Declined 
3 = Error 
4 = Held for Review

children.name: authCode
children.value: Authorization or approval code.

children.name: avsResultCode
children.value: Address Verification Service (AVS) response code.
children.format:
A = Address (Street) matches, ZIP does not.
B = Address information not provided for AVS check.
E = AVS error.
G = Non-U.S. Card Issuing Bank.
N = No Match on Address (Street) or ZIP.
P = AVS not applicable for this transaction.
R = Retry—System unavailable or timed out.
S = Service not supported by issuer.
U = Address information is unavailable.
W = Nine digit ZIP matches, Address (Street) does not.
X = Address (Street) and nine digit ZIP match.
Y = Address (Street) and five digit ZIP match.
Z = Five digit ZIP matches, Address (Street) does not.
children.notes: Indicates the result of the AVS filter.

children.name: cvvResultCode
children.value: Card code verification (CCV) response code.
children.format:
M = Match.
N = No Match.
P = Not Processed.
S = Should have been present.
U = Issuer unable to process request.
children.notes: Indicates result of the CCV filter.

children.name: cavvResultCode
children.value: Cardholder authentication verification response code.
children.format:
Blank or not present  =  CAVV not validated.
0 = CAVV not validated because erroneous data was submitted.
1 = CAVV failed validation.
2 = CAVV passed validation.
3 = CAVV validation could not be performed; issuer attempt incomplete.
4 = CAVV validation could not be performed; issuer system error.
5 = Reserved for future use.
6 = Reserved for future use.
7 = CAVV attempt—failed validation—issuer available (U.S.-issued card/non-U.S acquirer).
8 = CAVV attempt—passed validation—issuer available (U.S.-issued card/non-U.S. acquirer).
9 = CAVV attempt—failed validation—issuer unavailable (U.S.-issued card/non-U.S. acquirer).
A = CAVV attempt—passed validation—issuer unavailable (U.S.-issued card/non-U.S. acquirer).
B = CAVV passed validation, information only, no liability shift.

children.name: transId
children.value: The payment gateway assigned identification number for transaction.
children.format: When testRequest is set to a positive response, or when Test Mode is enabled on the payment gateway, this value will be 0.
children.notes: The transId value must be used for any follow-on transactions such as a credit, prior authorization and capture, or void.

children.name: reftransId
children.value: The transaction ID of a related, previously settled transaction.

children.name: transHash
children.value: Payment gateway-generated MD5 hash value that can be used to authenticate the transaction response.
children.notes: Because transaction responses are returned using an SSL connection, this feature is not necessary for AIM.

children.name: testRequest
children.notes: Indicates whether or not to treat this request as a test transaction.

children.name: messages
children.value: This element contains one or more <message> elements.

children.name: message
children.value: These messages contain detailed information about the status of a particular transaction.

children.name: code
children.value: Response code that represents the status.

children.name: description
children.value: Text description of the status.

children.name: errors
children.value: This element contains one or more <error> elements.

children.name: error
children.value: This element contains detailed information about any errors returned.

children.name: errorCode
children.value: Error code returned.

children.name: errorText
children.value: Text description of error.

children.name: splitTenderPayments
children.value: If the transaction was a partial authorization transaction, then the split tender payment detail information is listed in this section.

children.name: splitTenderPayment
children.value: Contains information about one split tender transaction.

children.name: transId
children.value: The payment gateway assigned identification number for the transaction.
children.notes: When the testRequest field is set to a positive response, or when Test Mode is enabled on the payment gateway, this value will be 0.

children.name: accountNumber
children.value: Last 4 digits of the card provided.
children.notes: This field is returned with all transactions.

children.name: accountType
children.value: Visa, MasterCard, American Express, Discover, Diners Club, or JCB.

children.name: requestedAmount
children.value: Amount requested in original authorization.
children.notes: Present if the current transaction is for a prepaid card or if the splitTenderId field was sent in.

children.name: approvedAmount
children.value: Amount approved.
children.notes: Present if the current transaction is for a prepaid card or if the splitTenderId field was sent in.

children.name: balanceOnCard
children.value: Balance on the debit card or prepaid card.
children.notes: Can be a positive or negative number. Has a value only if the current transaction is for a prepaid card.

children.name: userFields
children.value: This element contains user fields, if any are defined.

children.name: Name
children.value: Name of user-defined field.
children.notes: These values are only echoed back in the response, and are also added to the merchant receipts. No other action is taken with user-defined fields.

children.name: value
children.value: Value of user-defined field.
children.notes: These values are only echoed back in the response, and are also added to the merchant  receipts. No other action is taken with user-defined fields.

APIUsage: Recurring Billing API methods enable you to manage regular payment subscriptions.

methods.title: Create a Subscription
methods.usage: For subscriptions with a monthly interval, whose payments begin on the 31st of a month, payments for months with fewer than 31 days  occur on the last day of the month.

children.name: merchantAuthentication
children.value: Merchant account credentials.
children.notes: See the Merchant Authentication section.

children.name: refId
children.value: Merchant-assigned ID associated with the customer profile.
children.notes: If included in the request, this value is included in the response.

children.name: subscription
children.value: Contains information about the subscription.

children.name: name
children.value: Merchant-assigned name for the subscription.

children.name: paymentSchedule
children.value: Contains information about the payment schedule.

children.name: interval
children.value: Contains information about the time between payments.

children.name: length
children.value: The measurement of time, in association with the Interval Unit, that is used to define the frequency of the billing occurrences.
children.notes: If the Interval Unit is "months", can be any number between 1 and 12. If the Interval Unit is "days", can be any number between 7 and 365.

children.name: unit
children.value: The unit of time, in association with the Interval Length, between each billing occurrence.

children.name: startDate
children.value: The date the subscription begins (also the date the initial billing occurs).
children.notes:
The date entered must be greater than or equal to the date the subscription was created.

The validation checks against local server date, which is Mountain Time. An error might occur if you try to submit a subscription from a time zone in which the resulting date is different; for example, if you are in the Pacific time zone and try to submit a subscription between 11:00 PM and midnight, with a start date set for today. 

If the start date is the 31st, and the interval is monthly, the billing date is the last day of each month (even when the month does not have 31 days).

children.name: totalOccurrences
children.value: Number of billing occurrences or payments for the subscription.
children.notes:
To submit a subscription with no end date (an ongoing subscription), this field must be submitted with a value of 9999.

If a trial period is specified, this number should include the trial occurrences.

children.name: trialOccurrences
children.value: Number of billing occurrences or payments int he trial period.
children.notes: If a trial period is specified, this number must be included in the total occurrences.

children.name: amount
children.value: The amount to be billed to the customer for each payment in the subscription.
children.notes: If a trial period is specified, this figure is the amount that will be charged after the trial payments are complete.

children.name: trialAmount
children.value: The amount to be charged for each payment during the trial period.
children.notes:
Required when trialOccurrences is specified.

Once the number of trial occurrences is complete, the regular amount will be charged for each remaining payment.

children.name: payment
children.value: Contains either the customer's credit card or bank account payment information.

children.name: creditCard
children.value: Contains the customer's credit card information.
children.notes: Include this element only when the payment method is credit card.

children.name: cardNumber
children.value: The credit card number used for payment of the subscription.

children.name: expirationDate
children.value: The expiration date of the credit card used for the subscription.

children.name: cardCode
children.value: The three or four-digit card code on the back of most credit cards, on the front for American Express.
children.notes: Include this element only when the merchant has set the card code value field to required int he account settings. The value itself is never validated.

To submit a subscription with no end date (an ongoing subscription), this field must be submitted with a value of 9999.

If a trial period is specified, this number should include the trialOccurrences.

children.name: trialAmount
children.value: The amount to be charged for each payment during the trial period.
children.notes:
Required when trialOccurrences is specified.

Once the number of trial occurrences is complete, the regular amount will be charged for each remaining payment.

methods.title: Create Customer Profile
methods.usage:
Use this function to create a new customer profile including any customer payment profiles and customer shipping addresses.

Note: The createCustomerProfileResponse field returns only the assigned customerProfileId element for the created profile. To retrieve the customerPaymentProfileId element and the customerShippingId element that may also be created when using the createCustomerProfile function, you must submit the getCustomerProfileRequest function using the assigned customerProfileId element for that customer profile.

children.name: refId
children.value: Merchant-assigned reference ID for the request.
children.notes: If included in the request, this value will be included in the response. This feature might be especially useful for multi-threaded applications.

children.name: profile
children.value: Contains information for the customer profile.
children.notes: At least one of the following fields must be submitted under profile: merchantCustomerId, description, or email.

children.name: merchantCustomerId
children.value: Merchant assigned ID for the customer.
children.notes: Required only when no values for description and email are submitted.

children.name: description
children.value: Description of the customer or customer profile.
children.notes: Required only when no values for merchantCustomerId and email are submitted.

children.name: email
children.value: Email address associated with the customer profile.
children.notes:
Required when no values for description and merchantCustomerId are submitted.

Required only when you use a European payment processor.

children.name: paymentProfiles
children.value: Contains payment profiles for the customer profile.
children.notes: Multiple instances of this element can be submitted to create multiple payment profiles for the customer profile.

children.name: billTo
children.value: Customer billing information.

children.name: firstName
children.value: The customer’s first name.
children.notes: Required only when you use a European payment processor.

children.name: lastName
children.value: The customer’s last name.
children.notes: Required only when you use a European payment processor.

children.name: company
children.value: The name of the company associated with the customer, if applicable.

children.name: address
children.value: The customer’s address.
children.notes: Required only when you use a European payment processor.

children.name: city
children.value: The city of the customer’s address.
children.notes: Required only when you use a European payment processor.

children.name: state
children.value: The state of the customer’s address.
children.notes: Required only when you use a European payment processor.

children.name: zip
children.value: The ZIP code of the customer’s address.
children.notes: Required only when you use a European payment processor.

children.name: country
children.value: The country of the customer’s address.
children.notes: Required only when you use a European payment processor.

children.name: phoneNumber
children.value: The phone number associated with the customer profile.
children.format:
Up to 25 digits (no letters).
For example, (123)123-1234

children.name: faxNumber
children.value: The fax number associated with the customer profile.
children.format:
Up to 25 digits (no letters).
For example, (123)123-1234

children.name: payment
children.value: Contains payment profile information for the customer profile.
children.notes: Can contain creditCard or bankAccount.

children.name: creditCard
children.value: Contains credit card payment information for the payment profile.
children.notes: This element is required only when the payment profile is credit card.

children.name: cardNumber
children.value: The customer’s credit card number.

children.name: expirationDate
children.value: The expiration date for the customer’s credit card.

children.name: cardCode
children.value: The three- or four-digit number on the back of a credit card (on the front for American Express).
children.notes:
This field is required if the merchant would like to use the Card Code Verification (CCV) security feature.

The cardCode element is used only for validation and is not stored in the customer profile. Use it only when submitting the validationMode element with a value of testMode or liveMode.

children.name: bankAccount
children.value: Contains bank account payment information for the payment profile.
children.notes: This element is required only when the payment profile is bank account.

children.name: accountType
children.value: The type of bank account for the payment profile.

children.name: routingNumber
children.value: The routing number of the customer’s bank.

children.name: accountNumber
children.value: The customer’s bank account number.

children.name: nameOnAccount
children.value: The customer’s full name as listed on the bank account.

children.name: echeckType
children.value: The type of electronic check transaction.
children.notes: Currently, the CIM API does not support ARC or BOC transaction types.

children.name: bankName
children.value: The name of the bank associated with the bank account number.

children.name: shipToList
children.value: Contains shipping address information for the customer profile.

children.name: firstName
children.value: The customer’s first name.

children.name: lastName
children.value: The customer’s last name.

children.name: company
children.value: The name of the company associated with the customer, if applicable.

children.name: address
children.value: The customer’s shipping address.

children.name: city
children.value: The city of the customer’s shipping address.

children.name: state
children.value: The state of the customer’s shipping address.

children.name: zip
children.value: The ZIP code of the customer’s shipping address.

children.name: country
children.value: The country of the customer’s shipping address.

children.name: phoneNumber
children.value: The phone number associated with the customer profile.
children.format:
Up to 25 digits (no letters).
For example, (123)123-1234

children.name: faxNumber
children.value: The fax number associated with the customer profile.
children.format:
Up to 25 digits (no letters).
For example, (123)123-1234

children.name: validationMode
children.value: Indicates the processing mode for the request.

response.name: Output for createCustomerProfileResponse

children.name: refId
children.value: Merchant-assigned reference ID for the request.
children.notes: If included in the request, this value will be included in the response. This feature might be especially useful for multi-threaded applications.

children.name: customerProfileId
children.value: Payment gateway assigned ID associated with the customer profile.
children.notes: This output is present only for successful requests.

children.name: customerPaymentProfileIdList
children.value: A list of all payment profile IDs created with the request.
children.notes:
This output is present only for requests that contain one or more payment profiles.

The payment profile IDs are returned in the same order as they were in the request.

children.name: customerShippingAddressIdList
children.value: A list of all shipping profile IDs created with the request.
children.notes:
This output is present only for requests that contain multiple shipping profiles.

The shipping profile IDs are returned in the same order as they were in the request.

children.name: validationDirectResponseList
children.value: A list of the direct response results for the validation transaction for each payment profile.
children.notes:
This output is present only if the ValidationMode input element is passed with a value of testMode or liveMode.

The list is returned in the same order as the payment profiles were submitted in the request.

methods.title: Update Customer Payment Profile
methods.usage:
Use this function to update a payment profile for an existing customer profile.

Note that if some fields in this request are not submitted or are submitted with a blank value, the values in the original profile are removed. As a best practice to prevent this from happening, call getCustomerPaymentProfileRequest before calling updateCustomerPaymentProfileRequest. This action returns all current information including masked payment information. Then, simply change the field that needs updating and use that field to call updateCustomerPaymentProfileRequest.

To test the validity of new payment information, call validateCustomerPaymentProfileRequest after successfully updating the payment profile.

children.name: refId
children.value: Merchant-assigned reference ID for the request.
children.notes: If included in the request, this value will be included in the response. This feature might be especially useful for multi-threaded applications.

children.name: customerProfileId
children.value: Payment gateway-assigned ID associated with the customer profile.

children.notes: Sensitive information that is not being updated can be masked.

children.name: customerType
children.notes: If this field is not submitted in the request, or is submitted with a blank value, the original value will be removed from the profile.

children.name: billTo
children.notes:
If this entire section is not submitted, the original billing information for the profile will stay the same. 

If you update only one or more elements under billTo, all elements must be submitted with their valid values to prevent the original values from being removed.

request.name: Input Elements for createCustomerProfileTransactionRequest (Authorization Only Transactions)

children.value: The ID assigned to the item.

children.name: name
children.value: A short description of an item.

children.name: description
children.value: A detailed description of an item.

children.name: quantity
children.value: The quantity of an item.
children.format: Up to 4 digits (up to two decimal places).

children.format:
Up to 4 digits with a decimal point (no dollar symbol).

children.value: The merchant assigned purchase order number.

children.name: taxExempt
children.value: The tax exempt status.

children.name: recurringBilling
children.value: The recurring billing status.

children.value: The customer’s card code (the three- or four-digit number on the back or front of a credit card).
children.notes: This field is required if the merchant wants to use the Card Code Verification (CCV) security feature.

children.name: splitTenderId
children.value: Payment gateway-assigned number associated with the order.
children.notes: This field is required for second and subsequent transactions related to a partial authorization transaction.

children.name: extraOptions
children.value: Information in name/value pair format that does not exist within CIM, such as customer IP address.
children.notes: For a complete list of the transaction variable names available, review the AIM Developer Guide located at: http://www.authorize.net/support/AIM_guide.pdf.

request.sample:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<createCustomerProfileTransactionRequest xmlns="AnetApi/xml/v1/schema/AnetApiSchema.xsd">
  <merchantAuthentication>
    <name>API_LOGIN_ID</name>
    <transactionKey>API_TRANSACTION_KEY</transactionKey>
  </merchantAuthentication>

children.name: refId

Up to 4 digits after the decimal point (no dollar symbol).

children.name: amount
children.value: The tax amount for the transaction.
children.format:
Up to 4 digits after the decimal point (no dollar symbol).

children.notes: This amount must be included in the total amount for the transaction.

children.name: name
children.value: The name of the tax for the transaction.

children.name: description
children.value: The tax description for the transaction.

children.name: shipping

children.name: amount
children.value: The shipping amount for the transaction.
children.format:
Up to 4 digits after the decimal point (no dollar symbol).

children.notes: This amount must be included in the total amount for the transaction.

children.name: name

children.name: description

children.name: amount
children.value: The duty amount for the transaction.
children.format:
Up to 4 digits after the decimal point (no dollar symbol).
For example, 12.99 or 12.9999
children.notes: This amount must be included in the total amount for the transaction.

children.name: name
children.value: The name of the duty for the transaction.

children.name: description
children.value: The duty description for the transaction.

children.name: itemId

children.name: name

children.name: description
children.value: A detailed description of an item.

children.name: quantity
children.value: The quantity of an item.
children.format: Up to 4 digits (up to two decimal places).

children.name: unitPrice
children.value: Cost of an item per unit excluding tax, freight, and duty.
children.format:
Up to 4 digits with a decimal point (no dollar symbol).

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<createCustomerProfileTransactionRequest xmlns="AnetApi/xml/v1/schema/AnetApiSchema.xsd">
  <merchantAuthentication>

<lineItems>

<customerProfileId>10000</customerProfileId>

<order>

</createCustomerProfileTransactionRequest>

methods.title: Get Settled Batch List
methods.usage: This function returns Batch ID, Settlement Time, & Settlement State for all settled batches with a range of dates. If you specify includeStatistics, you also receive batch statistics by payment type and batch totals. All input parameters are optional. If no dates are specified, then the default is the past 24 hours (ending at the time of the call to getSettledBatchListRequest).

children.name: includeStatistics
children.value: true or false.
children.notes: Optional. The default is false.

children.name: firstSettlementDate
children.notes: Include this value if you want data for a range of dates other than the past 24 hrs.

children.name: lastSettlementDate
children.notes: Include this value if you want data for a range of dates other than the past 24 hours. The maximum date range is 31 days.

children.value: A text description of the status.

children.value: Contains information for all batches

children.notes: The “T” character separates the date from the time. This field returns the time in the merchant’s local time zone as set in the Merchant Interface.

children.name: AVSResponse
children.value: Response from the AVS security check.
children.format:
A = Address (Street) matches, ZIP does not
B = Address information not provided for AVS check
E = AVS error
G = Non-U.S. Card Issuing Bank
N = No Match on Address (Street) or ZIP
P = AVS not applicable for this transaction
R = Retry — System unavailable or timed out
S = Service not supported by issuer
U = Address information is unavailable
W = Nine digit ZIP matches, Address (Street) does not
X = Address (Street) and nine digit ZIP match
Y = Address (Street) and five digit ZIP match
Z = Five digit ZIP matches, Address (Street) does not
children.notes: Indicates the result of the AVS filter.

children.name: cardCodeResponse
children.value: Response from the card code security check.
children.format:
M = Match
N = No Match
P = Not Processed
S = Should have been present
U = Issuer unable to process request
children.notes: Indicates the result of the CCV filter.

children.name: CAVVResponse
children.value: The cardholder authentication verification response code.
children.format:
Blank or not present = CAVV not validated
0 = CAVV not validated because erroneous data was submitted
1 = CAVV failed validation
2 = CAVV passed validation
3 = CAVV validation could not be performed; issuer attempt incomplete
4 = CAVV validation could not be performed; issuer system error
5 = Reserved for future use
6 = Reserved for future use
7 = CAVV attempt — failed validation — issuer available (U.S.-issued card/non-U.S acquirer)
8 = CAVV attempt — passed validation — issuer available (U.S.-issued card/non-U.S. acquirer)
9 = CAVV attempt — failed validation — issuer unavailable (U.S.-issued card/non-U.S. acquirer)
A = CAVV attempt — passed validation — issuer unavailable (U.S.-issued card/non-U.S. acquirer)
B = CAVV passed validation, information only, no liability shift

methods.title: Get Unsettled Transaction List
